page.title: 06LEISURE IN BO'NESS
page.content: In this area of Bo'ness there are 3 parks Kinningars, so called because the King gave an acre of ground to the common people of Bo'ness, the Victoria Park and the Chance Park. There are several play areas with swings and chutes.There is a snooker centre, with about 12 snooker tables, at Bridgness Road. Many people in this area support the Bo'ness Junior Football Team. Bo'ness United have won the Junior Cup four times. They play in Newtown Park (GR 9980). There are 2 Bowling Clubs, Bo'ness Bowling Club and Bridgeness Bowling Club. Children can join as junior members. There are tennis courts next to the Bridgeness Bowling Club. Bo'ness Academy runs 3 evening classes. There is also a boat yard where sailing enthusiasts can keep their boats which they sail on the River Forth.
